Articles.Content:
(Just because I\'ve had two people raging at me the entire evening over my using print screen rather than F1, I\'ve decided to test it to see which I prefer through experience. Therefore, the screenshots will be F1ed.)

The VA Sparrow is a Short/Vertical Take Off & Landing spaceplane, designed solely for military operations. It can be outfitted with railguns or missiles, and it capable of vertical landing with its unusually stable RCS. However, due to high weight, the craft must be slowed to under 12 m/s to prevent impact breakup with standard landing gear. This is achieved by firing the forward-facing retros.

The Sparrow as standard

The Sparow rigged with railguns, RCS thrusters shown

The Sparrow rigged with four missiles, eah with independant launch.

Protip: Use F2

If I\'d wanted to use F2, I would have. Instead, I left the GUI up, and closed the nav-con.

Can we please talk about the spacecraft?

Requires C7 and I think Jellycube\'s weapons pack. The railguns, at least.

http://www./?pssc3pmqbkfc7h5

Sparrow Standard

http://www./?b6ag4pj48cxykob

Sparrow Interceptor

http://www./?d7736gqse6yte4r

Sparrow Grenadier

Built the Grenadier variant. Equipped with four independent-launch missiles. They deploy, then fire. However, I\'m thinking of reversing that. I\'ll see if it works better. At the moment they look like guided missiles.
